message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.MM

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the downlink of a mmWave heterogeneous network and explores the possibility of base station cooperation to reduce outage probability. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses different fading distributions and antenna directionality, which are concepts related to information theory. 
3. cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) - The paper deals with the issue of signal outage and interference in mmWave networks, which are topics related to communications and networking. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a cooperative approach to improve coverage probability in mmWave networks, which can be seen as a control system. 
5. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the use of highly directional transmissions in mmWave networks, which can be related to multimedia applications that require high data rates.
